Ellen Kaplan |known for = June 2012 disappearance | networth = }} '''Guma Leandro Aguiar''' (May 31, 1977 – disappeared June 19, 2012; [[Declared death in absentia|declared legally dead]] January 29, 2015{{Cite web|url=http://www.sun-sentinel.com/local/broward/fort-lauderdale/fl-guma-declared-dead-hearing-20150129-story.html|title=Broward judge declares missing millionaire dead|last=Sun-Sentinel|first=South Florida|website=Sun-Sentinel.com|access-date=2016-05-24}}) was a Brazilian-born American energy [[industrialist]] and millionaire businessman who split his time between the United States and Israel. Aguiar was recognized as a philanthropist who supported a variety of Jewish causes including [[Nefesh B'Nefesh]] and the [[March of the Living]].ASHER ZEIGER and JTA, [http://www.timesofisrael.com/body-feared-to-be-that-of-guma-aguiar-found-on-florida-coast/ Body feared to be that of Guma Aguiar found on Florida coast], June 22, 2012, Retrieved December 4, 2013 In July 2009, Aguiar invested over $4 million (USD) in support of the [[Beitar Jerusalem F.C.|Beitar Jerusalem Football Club]]. On June 20, 2012, Aguiar was reported missing after his unoccupied boat was found on Fort Lauderdale Beach.{{cite web |last=Trischitta |first=Linda |url=http://www.wptv.com/dpp/news/state/millionaire-guma-aguiars-ghost-vessel-comes-ashore-on-fort-lauderdale-beach |title=Millionaire Guma Aguiar's ghost vessel comes ashore on Fort Lauderdale beach |publisher=Wptv.com |date=2012-06-20 |accessdate=2012-07-09 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120623194328/http://www.wptv.com/dpp/news/state/millionaire-guma-aguiars-ghost-vessel-comes-ashore-on-fort-lauderdale-beach |archivedate=2012-06-23 |df= }} The day before Aguiar went missing, a federal court judge ordered his mental health records be presented to the court as part of a lawsuit between him and his uncle [[Thomas Kaplan]].{{cite web|last=Kamph |first=Stefan |url=http://blogs.browardpalmbeach.com/pulp/2012/06/guma_aguiars_mental_health_rec.php |title=Guma Aguiar's Mental Health Records Were Requested in Federal Court a Day Before He Vanished |publisher=Blogs.browardpalmbeach.com |date=2012-06-28 |accessdate=2013-12-02}} Aguiar was declared legally dead in January 2015. ==Early life and education== Aguiar was born on May 31, 1977http://www.flpd.org/Home/ShowDocument?id=2568 in Rio de Janeiro. He was one of four children{{Cite web|url=http://articles.sun-sentinel.com/2014-05-16/news/fl-guma-aguiar-estate-trial-openings-20140516_1_ellen-aguiar-guma-aguiar-jamie-aguiar|title=Missing Fort Lauderdale millionaire's mother, wife face off in Broward courtroom|access-date=2016-06-24}} of Ellen{{Cite web|url=http://www.israelnationalnews.com/News/News.aspx/187806#.V22XnqKhNow|title='Vanished' Millionaire Guma Aguiar's Estate Divided among Heirs|website=Arutz Sheva|access-date=2016-06-24}} ({{née}} Kaplan), a Jewish mother,[http://articles.sun-sentinel.com/2012-06-30/news/fl-guma-aguiar-troubled-life-20120630_1_ellen-aguiar-rocky-seas-guma-aguiar Florida Sun Sentinel: "Turmoil and depression haunted missing Fort Lauderdale millionaire Aguiar" By Linda Trischitta and Robert Nolin] June 30, 2012 and Otto de Souza Aguiar, a Christian father. His mother is the sister of billionaire investor [[Thomas Kaplan]], and his father was an artist and model.{{Cite web|url=http://www.miaminewtimes.com/news/the-mystery-of-missing-fort-lauderdale-millionaire-guma-aguiar-6389180|title=The Mystery of Missing Fort Lauderdale Millionaire Guma Aguiar|last=Kamph|first=Stefan|date=2012-09-20|access-date=2016-06-24}} Though Ellen is [[Halakha|halachically]] Jewish, she considers herself a [[Born again (Christianity)|born-again]] Christian; Guma was raised as a Christian and the rest of the Aguiar family practiced Christianity as well. At age 26, Aguiar returned to Jewish observance after meeting rabbi [[Tovia Singer]].{{cite web|url=http://www.thejc.com/lifestyle/lifestyle-features/20957/israels-abramovich-uses-football-unite-jerusalem|title=Israel's Abramovich uses football to unite Jerusalem | The Jewish Chronicle|date=2009-10-15|publisher=Thejc.com|accessdate=2012-07-09}} However, because he was born to an [[Halakha|halachically]] Jewish mother, he did not need to formally convert. His family moved to [[Fort Lauderdale, Florida]] when Aguiar was one year old. He graduated from the [[Westminster Academy (Florida)|Westminster Academy Christian School]] in 1995.{{cite web |last=Trischitta |first=Linda |url=http://www.wptv.com/dpp/news/state/guma-aguiar-video-interview-captures-missing-multimillionaire-in-happier-moments |title=Guma Aguiar video: Interview captures missing multimillionaire in happier moments |publisher=Wptv.com |date=2012-04-23 |accessdate=2013-12-02 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://archive.is/20131030095704/http://www.wptv.com/dpp/news/state/guma-aguiar-video-interview-captures-missing-multimillionaire-in-happier-moments |archivedate=2013-10-30 |df= }} Aguiar enrolled at [[Clemson University]] in [[Clemson, South Carolina]] but dropped out after one year. ==Career== Aguiar was the vice chairman and [[chief executive officer]] of [[Leor Energy]]. Aguiar began his career as a clerk on the floor of the [[New York Mercantile Exchange|NYMEX]] in 1999 where he focused on the energy markets, with particular emphasis on [[natural gas]]. Transitioning from daily trading activity to the long-term physical markets, Aguiar joined with his uncle, [[Thomas Kaplan]], in 2001 to manage a portfolio of family investments ranging from [[venture capital]] to [[private equity]] and debt. During this time, he served as a director of several public and private companies and was given responsibility for creating a U.S.-based energy company focused on aggressive early-stage oil and gas exploration. After assembling a diversified portfolio of energy properties in Louisiana and Texas, ranging from unconventional natural gas to shallow oil, Aguiar identified and executed Leor's acquisition of its flagship property in the [[Deep Bossier]] of [[East Texas]] in 2003. In 2005, under Aguiar's executive management, Leor Energy engineered financings which fully capitalized the projects in Leor Energy LP. Included in these transactions were Leor Energy Lp industrial alliance with Encana, a natural gas producer in North America and the Leor Energy Lp joint-venture partner in the Deep Bossier. Under Aguiar, a [[Mezzanine capital|mezzanine financing]] with hedge-fund Amaranth Capital LLC{{Citation needed|date=October 2013}} was achieved.{{cite web|author= |url=http://investing.businessweek.com/research/stocks/private/person.asp?personId=4288364&privcapId=27143526&previousCapId=27143526&previousTitle=Leor%20Energy%20L.P |title=Guma Aguiar: Executive Profile & Biography - Businessweek |publisher=Investing.businessweek.com |date=2003-06-30 |accessdate=2013-12-02}} Leor Energy has a financial alliance with its first strategic equity partner, [[Goldman Sachs|Goldman Sachs & Co]]. Aguiar joined Cadence Resources in July 2002 and served as a Member of the Board of Directors of Corporate Development until June 30, 2003. ==Philanthropic activities== Aguiar was the director of the Lillian Jean Kaplan Foundation and was involved in numerous philanthropic activities.{{cite web|url=http://articles.sun-sentinel.com/2009-01-25/news/0901240172_1_messiah-guma-aguiar-nephew|title=Multimillion-dollar family feud in court|work=tribunedigital-sunsentinel|accessdate=14 June 2015}} He donated more than US$8 million to fund the activities of [[Nefesh B'Nefesh]], a [[Zionist]] organization which promotes [[Aliyah]] (Jewish immigration) from North America and the United Kingdom to Israel. He was a supporter of the [[March of the Living]], which organizes educational programming in Poland and Israel to enable students to better understand the [[Holocaust]] and the rebirth of [[Zionism]] and the creation of the modern Jewish state of Israel. For his philanthropic activities, in April 2009, [[The Jewish Week]] recognized Aguiar as one of the "36 under 36″ (one of 36 of the most influential Jewish leaders under the age of 36).{{cite web|url=http://www.thejewishweek.com/special_sections/36_under_36/36_under_36_2009_guma_aguiar_33|title=36 Under 36 2009: Guma Aguiar, 33 - The Jewish Week|work=The Jewish Week|accessdate=14 June 2015|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160303172755/http://www.thejewishweek.com/special_sections/36_under_36/36_under_36_2009_guma_aguiar_33|archivedate=3 March 2016|df=}} In 2008, Aguiar founded the "Defender of Jerusalem Award" which recognizes public figures who have taken uniquely strong stances in support of Jerusalem.{{cite web|url=http://www.nbcdfw.com/news/local/Perry-in-Israel-to-Receive--53135252.html|title=Perry in Israel to Receive Defender of Jerusalem Award|work=NBC 5 Dallas-Fort Worth|accessdate=14 June 2015}} In October 2009, Aguiar and his wife Jamie served as the co-chairs of the "Facing Tomorrow" Conference in Jerusalem organized by Israel's President [[Shimon Peres]]. During the conference, Aguiar was featured on a panel with the President and offered his vision of Israeli society and culture from the perspective of one of the country's most recognized entrepreneurs. ==Jerusalem sports== On July 21, 2009, Aguiar announced an investment of over US$4 million to support the [[Beitar Jerusalem]] [[Football team|Football Team]] which, despite a massive fan following, had grown into [[financial distress]] and was on the brink of collapse prior to Aguiar's financial contributions. Aguiar was motivated to purchase the team out of his love for the sport combined with a passion for Jerusalem and Israel. In September 2009, Aguiar took his commitment to Jerusalem sports to the next level when he invested over $1.5 million in the city's leading basketball franchise, [[Hapoel Jerusalem B.C.|Hapoel Jerusalem]]. Since these investments, Aguiar became a fixture in Israeli social circles and regularly met with members of Knesset and local political and business leaders. Aguiar managed the teams and was in contact with the general managers of both Betar ([[Itzik Kornfein]]) and Hapoel (Dani Klein). In November 2009, Aguiar travelled with Kornfein to Brazil with the goal of scouting out players for the Betar team. He made an effort to be at team practices and met with the players and staff of both teams. Beitar fans attribute Beitar's winning the [[Toto Cup]] on 26 January 2010 to Aguiar's financial backing, although it was won while Aguiar was hospitalized in a psychiatric facility. About a half an hour after winning, Itzik Kornfein{{cite web |url=http://www.sport5.co.il/articles.aspx?FolderID=282&docID=72728&lang=HE |title=קורנפיין נסע עם גביע הטוטו לאגיאר |publisher=Sport5.co.il |date=2010-01-26 |accessdate=2012-09-28 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://archive.is/20130108072905/http://www.sport5.co.il/articles.aspx?FolderID=282&docID=72728&lang=HE |archivedate=2013-01-08 |df= }} took the Toto Cup to the psychiatric hospital but was not permitted to enter. He asked the security staff to take in the trophy to the hospitalized Aguiar. ==Personal life== In 2005, Aguiar married his [[Westminster Academy (Florida)|Westminster Academy]] high school sweetheart, Jamie Elizabeth Black. Jamie graduated from the [[University of Florida]] with a degree in Public Relations.{{cite web|url=http://articles.sun-sentinel.com/2012-06-30/news/fl-guma-aguiar-troubled-life-20120630_1_ellen-aguiar-rocky-seas-guma-aguiar |title=Guma Aguiar: Missing Fort Lauderdale millionaire's life was in turmoil - Sun Sentinel |publisher=Articles.sun-sentinel.com |date=2012-06-30 |accessdate=2013-12-02}} They had four children, Jacob, Lilly, Jonathan, and Leo{{cite web|url=http://law.justia.com/cases/federal/district-courts/new-york/nysdce/1:2011mc00290/383539/3/3.html|title=Document 3 :: Ellen Aguiar v. William Natbony, et al :: 1:2011mc00290 :: New York Southern District Court :: US Federal District Courts Cases :: Justia|date=|publisher=Law.justia.com|accessdate=2013-12-02}} and celebrated both Christmas and Hanukkah.[http://www.dailymail.co.uk/news/article-2253254/Wife-missing-millionaire-Guma-Aguiar-speaks-grief-holiday-season.html The Daily Mail: "Wife of millionaire who mysteriously vanished on night-time boat ride tells of her heartache as she spends first Christmas alone with their children"] December 25, 2012 The process of immigration to Israel was an act described by himself as a personal dream.{{citation needed|date=May 2013}} Prior to his disappearance, Aguiar divided his time between the [[Yemin Moshe]] quarter in [[Jerusalem]] and South Florida. Aguiar was friends with [[Alan Dershowitz]].{{cite web|author= |url=http://www.thedailybeast.com/articles/2012/08/27/new-clues-in-the-mysterious-disappearance-of-multimillionaire-guma-aguiar.html |title=New Clues in the Mysterious Disappearance of Multimillionaire Guma Aguiar |publisher=Thedailybeast.com |date=2012-08-27 |accessdate=2013-12-02}} Aguiar was a [[Zionism|Zionist]]. ==Criminal history== Aguiar pleaded no contest to drug charges in 2009 after police found marijuana in his car during a traffic stop in Florida.{{cite web|author= |url=http://www.cbsnews.com/8301-201_162-57460337/ |title=Missing oil tycoon Guma Aguiar was spiraling out of control before vanishing at sea, friends say |publisher=CBS News |date=2012-06-26 |accessdate=2013-12-02}}{{cite web|url=http://articles.sun-sentinel.com/2012-06-30/news/fl-guma-aguiar-troubled-life-20120630_1_ellen-aguiar-rocky-seas-guma-aguiar/2 |title=Guma Aguiar: Missing Fort Lauderdale millionaire's life was in turmoil - Page 2 - Sun Sentinel |publisher=Articles.sun-sentinel.com |date=2012-06-30 |accessdate=2013-12-02}}{{cite web|author=Stefan Kamph |url=http://www.miaminewtimes.com/2012-09-20/news/fort-lauderdale-millionaire-guma-aguiar-s-disappearance-at-sea-is-a-mystery/5/ |title=The Mystery of Missing Fort Lauderdale Millionaire Guma Aguiar - Page 5 - News - Miami |publisher=Miami New Times |date=2012-09-20 |accessdate=2013-12-02}}{{cite web|url=http://www.vosizneias.com/39972/2009/10/18/fort-lauderdale-fl-multimillionaire-who-accused-broward-deputies-of-anti-semitism-takes-plea-deal/ |title=Fort Lauderdale, FL - Multimillionaire Who Accused Broward Deputies of Anti-Semitism Takes Plea Deal |publisher=VosIzNeias.com |date= |accessdate=2013-12-02}} Aguiar publicly stated that the police were out to get him and that "When I got to the prison [an officer] took my kippah off and then tried to convert me to Christianity."{{cite web|url=http://www.haaretz.com/alan-dershowitz-enlisted-by-guma-aguiar-to-take-on-fla-law-1.5540 |title=Alan Dershowitz enlisted by Guma Aguiar to take on Fla. law |publisher=Haaretz.com |accessdate=2013-12-02}} Aguiar hired [[Alan Dershowitz]] to represent him.{{cite web |url=http://israelity.com/2010/01/14/israeli-billionaire-in-psychiatric-hospital/ |title=Israeli billionaire in psychiatric hospital |publisher=Israelity |date=2010-01-14 |accessdate=2013-12-02 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20131102075629/http://israelity.com/2010/01/14/israeli-billionaire-in-psychiatric-hospital/ |archivedate=2013-11-02 |df= }} Aguiar's wife Jamie filed a domestic violence protective order against him in the summer of 2011. He then filed for divorce, but both the domestic violence allegations and the divorce filing were stopped. ==Mental health== Aguiar's mother has said that Aguiar experienced his first [[Psychosis|psychotic]] episode at age 19 and that he was diagnosed with severe [[Bipolar I disorder|bipolar]] disorder and psychosis.{{cite web|url=http://abcnews.go.com/US/missing-millionaire-guma-aguiars-billionaire-uncle-thomas-kaplan/story?id=16703264 |title=Missing Millionaire Guma Aguiar's Billionaire Uncle Thomas Kaplan Is Suspicious - ABC News |publisher=Abcnews.go.com |date=2012-07-03 |accessdate=2013-12-02}} Aguiar was admitted to psychiatric hospitals several times.{{cite web |last=Trischitta |first=Linda |url=http://www.wptv.com/dpp/news/national/guma-aguiar-missing-turmoil-and-depression-haunted-missing-fort-lauderdale-millionaire |title=Guma Aguiar missing: Turmoil and depression haunted missing Fort Lauderdale millionaire |publisher=Wptv.com |date= |accessdate=2013-12-02 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://archive.is/20131030095720/http://www.wptv.com/dpp/news/national/guma-aguiar-missing-turmoil-and-depression-haunted-missing-fort-lauderdale-millionaire |archivedate=2013-10-30 |df= }} On January 14, 2010, Aguiar was [[Involuntary commitment|involuntarily committed]] to a mental hospital in Israel by his mother.{{cite web|author= |url=http://abcnews.go.com/US/rabbis-facilitate-truce-missing-millionaire-guma-aguiars-mom/story?id=16671744&page=2 |title=Page 2: Rabbis Facilitate Truce Between Missing Millionaire Guma Aguiar's Mom and Wife - ABC News |publisher=Abcnews.go.com |date=2012-06-28 |accessdate=2013-12-02}}{{cite web|last=Tracy |first=Marc |url=http://www.tabletmag.com/news-and-politics/23723/prodigal-son/ |title=Prodigal Son - by Allison Hoffman - Tablet Magazine – Jewish News and Politics, Jewish Arts and Culture, Jewish Life and Religion |publisher=Tabletmag.com |date=2010-01-15 |accessdate=2012-07-09}}{{cite web|url=https://www.forbes.com/sites/nathanvardi/2012/06/28/the-tragedy-of-guma-aguiar-and-a-2-billion-texas-gas-fortune/ |title=The Tragedy Of Guma Aguiar And A $2 Billion Texas Gas Fortune |publisher=Forbes |date= |accessdate=2013-12-02}}{{cite web|url=http://www.jpost.com/Israel/Betar-sponsor-in-psychiatric-hospital |title=Betar sponsor in psychiatric hospital | JPost | Israel News |publisher=JPost |date=2010-01-17 |accessdate=2013-12-02}}{{cite web|url=http://www.vosizneias.com/46976/2010/01/14/jerusalem-court-orders-guma-aguiar-to-psychiatric-hospital/ |title=Jerusalem - Court Orders Guma Aguiar To Psychiatric Hospital |publisher=VosIzNeias.com |date= |accessdate=2013-12-02}} In 2011, due to his mental illness, his wife Jamie and mother Ellen petitioned a [[Miami-Dade County, Florida|Miami-Dade]] judge for guardianship over Aguiar. The court agreed, and appointed an emergency guardianship over Aguiar.{{cite web|author= |url=http://abcnews.go.com/US/troubled-florida-millionaire-guma-aguiar-missing-empty-yacht/story?id=16619645&page=2 |title=Page 2: Troubled Florida Millionaire Guma Aguiar Missing After Empty Yacht Washes Ashore - ABC News |publisher=Abcnews.go.com |date=2012-06-21 |accessdate=2013-12-02}} Two days after his disappearance in June 2012, Aguiar's mother filed documents in Broward County, Florida court to become [[Conservatorship|conservator]] of his nearly $100 million fortune. In Ellen Aguiar's petition, she wrote that Guma "disappeared as the result of mental derangement or other mental cause" or disappeared "under circumstances indicating that he may have died, either naturally, or accidentally." It further stated that he suffered from "severe bipolar disorder."{{cite web|author= |url=http://articles.sun-sentinel.com/2012-06-22/news/fl-guma-aguiar-missing-folo-20120621_1_fishing-boat-search-ends-petition |title=Missing millionaire Guma Aguiar - Sun Sentinel |publisher=Articles.sun-sentinel.com |date=2012-06-22 |accessdate=2013-12-02}} Aguiar was sued by his uncle [[Thomas Kaplan]]. As part of that lawsuit, the judge presiding over the case, John O'Sullivan, found that Aguiar's psychosis "manifested itself in both grandiose and paranoid delusions," for example, Aguiar's belief that he (Aguiar) was being followed by snipers. On the day Aguiar disappeared, a federal judge in Florida issued an order appointing an independent medical examiner to see if Aguiar was psychologically sound enough for a deposition in the case. ==Disappearance== On June 20, 2012, Aguiar's 31-foot, center console Jupiter boat, named the ''T.T. Zion'',{{cite web|url=http://articles.sun-sentinel.com/2012-06-20/news/fl-missing-fort-lauderdale-boater-20120620_1_detective-travis-mandell-fishing-boat-captain |title=Millionaire missing after boat washes ashore on Fort Lauderdale beach | first = Linda | last = Trischitta | first2 = Jon | last2 = Burstein | work = Sun Sentinel |date=2012-06-20 |accessdate=2013-12-02}}{{cite web |last=Trischitta |first=Linda |url=http://www.wptv.com/dpp/news/state/guma-aguiar-missing-as-the-search-ends-for-missing-millionaire-mother-seeks-to-protect-his-assets |title=Guma Aguiar missing: As the search ends for missing millionaire, mother seeks to protect his assets |publisher=WPTV.com |date=2012-06-22 |accessdate=2013-12-02 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120624235845/http://www.wptv.com/dpp/news/state/guma-aguiar-missing-as-the-search-ends-for-missing-millionaire-mother-seeks-to-protect-his-assets |archivedate=2012-06-24 |df= }}{{cite web|url=http://www.upi.com/Top_News/US/2012/06/21/Yacht-tender-washes-ashore-without-owner/UPI-20981340307068/ |title=Yacht tender washes ashore without owner Guma Aguiar |publisher=UPI.com |date=2012-06-21 |accessdate=2013-12-02}} landed on Fort Lauderdale Beach east of East Las Olas Boulevard around 1:15 a.m., with its navigation lights on and engines still running, according to the ''[[Sun-Sentinel]]''. [[Sea Tow]], the company that Fort Lauderdale authorities contracted to tow the boat, said that the vessel appeared seaworthy and did not believe a mechanical problem had occurred. Aguiar's wallet and cell phone were found on board, but no sign of him or any other passenger was found. Authorities on [[All-terrain vehicle|ATVs]] searched up and down the beach, but found no sign of Aguiar. The [[United States Coast Guard|Coast Guard]] commenced a search at sea. A search of his house found that his watch and wedding band had been left behind.{{cite web|url=http://www.dailymail.co.uk/news/article-2197830/Guma-Aguiar-Missing-millionaire-left-wedding-ring-watch-night-disappeared.html |title=Guma Aguiar: Missing millionaire left his wedding ring and watch behind on night he disappeared... but he bought [sic] along a special Jewish text for 'solace' | first = Beth | last = Stebner | first2 = Meghan | last2 = Keneally |publisher=DailyMail.co.uk |date=2012-09-03 |accessdate=2013-12-02}} In July 2012 and June 2013, the Ft. Lauderdale Police Department said that even though the investigation remains open, there have been no significant leads in the case.{{cite web|url=http://www.shmais.com/chabad-news/latest/item/new-clues-in-the-mysterious-disappearance-of-multimillionaire-guma-aguiar |title=New Clues in the Mysterious Disappearance of Multimillionaire Guma Aguiar |publisher=Shmais.com |date=2012-08-27 |accessdate=2013-12-02}}{{cite news | url = http://www.huffingtonpost.com/2013/06/19/guma-aguiar-update-2013_n_3463073.html | title = Guma Aguiar: Fate of Missing Fort Lauderdale Millionaire Still A Mystery One Year Later | work = Sun Sentinel | first = Linda | last = Trischitta | date = August 18, 2013 | location = Fort Lauderdale, Florida}} Aguiar was declared legally dead on January 29, 2015, two years and seven months after his disappearance.{{Cite news |url=http://www.sun-sentinel.com/local/broward/fort-lauderdale/fl-guma-declared-dead-hearing-20150129-story.html|title=Broward judge declares missing millionaire dead| first = Linda | last = '''Guy Dollé''' (born 1942)<ref name="ReferenceforbusinessDoll">{{cite web|url=http://www.referenceforbusiness.com/biography/A-E/Doll-Guy-1942.html|title=Guy Dollé 1942— Biography - International influence, Promotes negotiation rather than confrontation|publisher=referenceforbusiness.com|accessdate=2016-06-26}}</ref> is a French [[businessman]]. He was the [[Chief executive officer|CEO]] of the European steel manufacturer [[Arcelor]] until 2006. He was ousted as CEO following Arcelor's merger with [[Mittal Steel]], at the end of a protracted takeover contest.<ref name="Nytimes27Steels">{{cite web|url=https://www.nytimes.com/2006/06/27/business/worldbusiness/27steels.html?_r=0|title=Arcelor's Chief Is Ousted From Mittal Partnership - The New York Times|publisher=nytimes.com|author=James Kanter|date=June 27, 2006|accessdate=2016-06-26}}</ref><ref name="MoneycontrolArcelor">{{cite web|url=http://www.moneycontrol.com/news/business/arcelor-mittal-tie-knotguy-dolle-refuses-to-be-ceo_223100.html|title=Arcelor-Mittal tie the knot: Guy Dolle refuses to be CEO|date=June 27, 2006|publisher=moneycontrol.com|accessdate=2016-06-26}}</ref><ref name="Nytimes26Iht">{{cite web|url=https://www.nytimes.com/2006/05/26/business/worldbusiness/26iht-arcelor.html|title=Arcelor offers deal to Russian steel giant - The New York Times|publisher=nytimes.com|author=Heather Timmons, James Kanter and Andrew E. Kramer|accessdate=2016-06-26}}</ref>
Dolle had opposed the takeover, preferring a hastily drawn up plan to merge with Russian company Severstal, praising the owner as a "true European."<ref name="NytimesFullpage">{{cite web|url=https://query.nytimes.com/gst/fullpage.html?res=9A02E6DB1E3EF934A15756C0A9609C8B63|title=Arcelor, Trying to Fend Off Suitor, Is Buying Russian Steel Company|author=Heather Timmons and James Kanter|date=May 27, 2006|publisher=NYTimes.com|accessdate=2016-06-26}}</ref> He described Mittal's products as low-grade eau de cologne compared with perfumes produced by Arcelor. He had also described Mittal's shares as "monkey money", interpreted by many as a racist attack on Mittal.<ref name="TelegraphMittal">{{cite web|url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/finance/2931587/Mittal-to-blame-for-personal-barbs.html|title='Mittal to blame' for personal barbs|publisher=Telegraph|author=By Edward Simpkins|date=February 5, 2006|accessdate=2016-06-26}}</ref>
In an article entitled "Arcelor's Chief Is Ousted From Mittal Partnership", the NY Times wrote that it was announced that Arcelor Mittal would be replacing him with a new chief executive. Mr. Dollé, who sat silently in the front row, hastily left the news conference refusing to answer questions.<ref name="Nytimes27Steels"/>

{{Orphan|date=August 2014}} '''Hélder Bataglia dos Santos''' ([[Seixal]], January 25, 1947) <ref>{{Cite web|url=http://angola-luanda-pitigrili.com/who%E2%80%99s-who/h/helder-jose-bataglia-dos-santos|title=Hélder José Bataglia dos Santos « Pitigrili|website=angola-luanda-pitigrili.com|language=en-US|access-date=2017-07-11}}</ref> is a [[Portugal|Portuguese]]-[[Angola]]n businessman. He creates, develops and manages financial projects in [[Africa]], specifically in Angola, in both Congos, [[South Africa]] and [[Mozambique]]. Hélder Bataglia is founder and president of the [[Escom Group]].<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.escom-group.eu/en/|title=Purchase Domains at DomainProfi|website=www.escom-group.eu|access-date=2017-07-11}}</ref>
== Biography == At the age of one year Helder Bataglia arrives in Angola, at the time a [[Portuguese Angola|Portuguese colony]]. His father was a director of a [[Germany|German]] fish flour production company in the [[Benguela province]]. Hélder is raised in the municipality of Baía Farta and attends a local school. At the age of ten he leaves Baía Farta to study in [[Benguela]] and later at the Institute of Industry of [[Huambo]], [[Bié Plateau|Central Plateau of Angola]]. He studies [[engineering]], interrupted by the military service from 1969 to 1972 with [[Portuguese Armed Forces]]. From 1972 to 1974 he starts a profitable fish transformation company using an innovative technique for artificial drying. In 1975 he relocates to [[Lisbon]] with his first wife and daughter.
== Career == Once in [[Portugal]] he enters business and travels across the [[Middle East]], particularly [[Kuwait]], [[Irak]], [[Iran]] and [[Algeria]]. In 1980, in [[Egypt]], he met his second wife, daughter of an [[Italy|Italian]] businessman in the construction and infrastructure sector. In 1982, he participates in an international cooperation project to develop vocational training in [[Algeria]].<ref>Project ONEP - 1982 : vocational training centre in the areas of mechanics, sewing, drawing, photography electromechanics, carpentry, metalwork.</ref> In 1985, he leaves for the former [[USSR]], where he participates in the construction of tannery factories and shoe factories, then requested by the [[Soviet]] government.
In 1991 Hélder Bataglia returns to Portugal. The following year, the [[Espírito Santo Financial Group|Espírito Santo Group]] (GES) appoints him to create [[Escom Group]], an investment company to support GES transactions in [[Angola]]. These activities were then expanded to the [[Republic of the Congo]], [[South Africa]] (2009) and [[Mozambique]] (2011) where he founded [[Networx]]. Since 2013, Hélder Bataglia has been working with international [[investment fund]]s with the aim of creating projects the infrastructure and transportation sectors in Africa, particularly in Angola, Mozambique and the Republic of the Congo. Since 2004 Hélder Bataglia has a pivotal role in the straightening of ties between [[China]] and [[Angola]] by facilitating contacts between both countries via the Escom, ''China Beya Escom International Limited''<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://hlgxx.com/china-beiya-escom-international-limited-itpoei/#.U6lsufl_vwg|title=Welcome to HLGXX.COM|website=hlgxx.com|access-date=2017-07-11}}</ref> and [[Sonangol]], the Angolan public oil production company.
=== The case of the submarines === In 2004, Escom provides assistance to German Submarine Consortium (GSG) in defining the compensation incentives included in [[:pt:Caso dos submarinos|the sale of two submarines to Portugal]]. The success of the transaction provides Escom with a 2.5% profit on the sale price, €25 million. The Public prosecution in Portugal ordered an inquiry into the process due to suspicions of bribery and corruption, later confirmed by German authorities.<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.algarvedailynews.com/cases/submarine-case/9496-germans-prove-6-4-million-submarine-bribe-was-received-by-portuguese-elite|title=Germans prove €6.4 million submarine bribe was received by four Portuguese elite|last=Rees|first=Paul|website=www.algarvedailynews.com|language=en-gb|access-date=2017-07-11}}</ref> Escom's board of directors was heard several times, but no proof was noticed apart from the fact that Battaglia was involved in money transfers that were the starting point of investigations.<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://observador.pt/especiais/quem-recebeu-de-ricardo-salgado-quando-como-e-porque/|title=Quem recebeu de Ricardo Salgado. Quando, como e porquê|last=Rosa|first=Luís|website=Observador|language=pt-PT|access-date=2017-07-11}}</ref> The latest hearing by the chairman of the Parliament's investigatory committee,<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.publico.pt/2014/08/26/politica/noticia/responsaveis-da-escom-asseguram-que-ges-conhecia-os-pagamentos-do-consorcio-alemao-dos-submarinos-1667719|title=Responsáveis da Escom asseguram que GES conhecia os pagamentos do consórcio alemão dos submarinos|last=Pena|first=Paulo|website=PÚBLICO|access-date=2017-07-11}}</ref> held on 25 August 2014, brought an end to a decade-long investigation, clearing Helder Bataglia of any wrongdoing in the case,<ref>http://media.parlamento.pt/videos-canal/XII/SL3/02_com/18_cipraem/20140826ciem_hb.wmv</ref> even though he has been associated to it both by German authorities <ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.algarvedailynews.com/cases/submarine-case/9496-germans-prove-6-4-million-submarine-bribe-was-received-by-portuguese-elite|title=Germans prove €6.4 million submarine bribe was received by four Portuguese elite|last=Rees|first=Paul|website=www.algarvedailynews.com|language=en-gb|access-date=2017-07-11}}</ref> and business partners that testified that Bataglia has received funds,<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://observador.pt/2014/10/02/houve-outra-pessoa-receber-parte-dos-30-milhoes-pagos-escom/|title=Houve outra pessoa a receber parte dos 30 milhões pagos à Escom|last=Castanho|first=Ana|last2=Castanho|first2=Ana|website=Observador|access-date=2017-07-11}}</ref> as well as in the [[Panama Papers]] scandal.<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://leitor.expresso.pt/#library/expressodiario/09-05-2016/caderno-1/temas-principais/os-70-nomes-portugueses-nos-panama-papers-ja-publicados-|title=Impresa Digital Reader|website=leitor.expresso.pt|access-date=2017-07-11}}</ref>
=== Personal achievements === In 1995, Hélder Bataglia establishes the NGO ''Apoiar África'' (Aid Africa),<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.apoiar.org/|title=APOIAR {{!}} A Força Que Nos Move|website=www.apoiar.org|language=en-US|access-date=2017-07-11}}</ref> operating in Mozambique and Angola, primarily in the area of education. One of its first humanitarian acts was to support the opening of an orphanage in Angola. Escom Group carries out corporate social responsibility activities in Angola,<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.escom-group.eu/social/|title=Purchase Domains at DomainProfi|website=www.escom-group.eu|access-date=2017-07-11}}</ref> particularly in basic education and adult literacy in mining areas where the Group operates, as well as, supporting projects for primary health care in the communities. Hélder Bataglia was awarded the title of Commander of the [[Order of Prince Henry]] of Portugal in 2007.<ref>Exame Angola (magazine), June 2010 - pages 20 and 21</ref> He was also awarded the Order of Merit by the President of the Republic of the Congo.<ref>Les dépêches de Brazzaville no.292 (newspaper) – Monday 13 August 2007 - page 5.</ref> In 2012, Hélder Bataglia publishes a book in English, Portrait of a New Angola, which illustrates the state of reconstruction and the economic boost of the new Angola, including photographs by Francesca Galliani and Walter Fernandes.<ref>{{Cite book|url=https://www.amazon.com/Portrait-New-Angola-Francesca-Galliani/dp/8857204707|title=Portrait of A New Angola|last=Galliani|first=Francesca|last2=Fernandes|first2=Walter|date=2012-12-04|publisher=Skira|isbn=9788857204703|language=English}}</ref>

{{no footnotes|date=September 2014}} '''Henrique de Araújo de Sommer''' ([[Lisbon]], 29 January 1886 — [[Cascais]], 28 March 1944) was one of Portugal's most important industrialists.
He was a member of a German aristocratic family living in [[Portugal]], since his grandfather Heinrich Baron von Sommer joined the armies of D. [[Pedro IV of Portugal]], married a Portuguese lady and started a company - Casa Sommer & Cia. dedicated to importing iron.
Henrique de Sommer, after commercial studies in England, was called at the age of 26 to manage his family businesses.
He started the production of Portland cement at the Maceira Liz factory in 1923, being still remembered for his social work, and the out of ordinary working conditions for the factory workers.
With the acquisition of the Companhia de Cimentos Tejo in 1935 he became Portugal's main cement producer.
He experimented with the Basset method of iron ingot, but met with little success, having set along with a project of expansion of his cement production to Mozambique the path that would later be followed by his nephew [[António Champalimaud]].
He had no children, and the division of his inheritance among his nephews and niece was sadly known as the Sommer Inheritance Case, the longest lawsuit in Portuguese history.

{{About|a type of corporate board member|directors of independently-made motion pictures|Independent film}} {{Redirect|Outside director|directors not part of an executive team|Non-executive director}} {{EngvarB|date=May 2014}} {{Use dmy dates|date=May 2014}} An '''independent director''' (also sometimes known as an '''outside director''') is a director (member) of a board of directors who does not have a material or pecuniary relationship with company or related persons, except sitting fees. In the US, independent outsiders make up 66% of all boards and 72% of [[S&P 500]] company boards, according to [[The Wall Street Journal]].[http://www.tamkeenconsult.com/pdf/dna2_v1.pdf Corporate Governance on an International Level, Tamkeen, 2010] == Legal requirements == === United States === The [[New York Stock Exchange|NYSE]] and [[NASDAQ]] stock exchange standards for independent directors are similar. Both require that "a majority of the board of directors of a listed company be 'independent,'"[http://corporate.findlaw.com/finance/sec-approves-nyse-and-nasdaq-proposals-relating-to-director.html SEC Approves NYSE and NASDAQ Proposals Relating to Director Independence]| corporate.findlaw.com| 2008-03-26 Both allow compensation for directors of $120,000/year or less (as of August 2008).[http://www.chadbourne.com/clientalerts/2008/defofinddir/ Client Alert. Nasdaq and NYSE Amend Definition of Independent Director]| Chadbourne & Parke| 5 September 2008) The NYSE states:
"no director qualifies as 'independent' unless the board of directors affirmatively determines that the director has 'no material relationship' with the listed company, either directly or as a partner, shareholder or officer of an organization that has a relationship with the company."[http://tcbblogs.org/governance/2010/09/10/just-what-is-an-independent-director-anyway/ Just What is an Independent Director Anyway? ] Governance Center Blog, The Conference Board
Nasdaq's rules say that an independent director must not be an officer or employee of the company or its subsidiaries or any other individual having a relationship that, in the opinion of the company's board of directors, would interfere with the exercise of independent judgment in carrying out the responsibilities of a director. According to the Conference Board, "other than [[Listing (finance)|delisting]] a company ... there really is no penalty" by the stock exchanges or the [[U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission|SEC]] for not having enough independent directors. === India === In India as of 2017, a majority of the minimum two directors of public companies having share capital in excess of Rs. 100 million (Rs 100,000,000) should be independent. Clause 49 of the listing agreements defines independent directors as follows:
"For the purpose of this clause the expression 'independent directors' means directors who apart from receiving director's remuneration, do not have any other material pecuniary relationship or transactions with the company, its promoters, its management or its subsidiaries, which in judgment of the board may affect independence of judgment of the directors."[https://web.archive.org/web/20100619130652/http://www.wcfcg.net/ht130304.htm Are we making a mockery of independent directors?] Dr. Madhav Mehra, President, World Council for Corporate Governance (circa 2004)
[[The Companies Act, 2013]], most sections of which got implemented from 1 April 2014, has mandated all listed public companies to have at least one-third of the total Directors to be independent. Whereas in the case of unlisted public companies, the following class of companies shall have at least two directors as independent directors: (i) Public Companies having paid up share capital of Ten Crore rupees or more; or (ii) Public Companies having turnover of One Hundred Crore rupees or more; or (iii) Public Companies which have, in aggregate, outstanding loans, debentures and deposits exceeding 50 Crore rupees or more. The Companies Act, 2013 is drafted taking into consideration the noteworthy inputs and contribution that an Independent Director can bring in to the business. Section 149(6) of the act stipulates the criteria for a candidate that ensures highest standards of integrity, while also preventing any conflict of interest. The provisions seek to ensure the autonomy of the appointee to facilitate effective discharge of duties such as upholding shareholders' interest, upholding corporate governance standards, among others.[http://www.mca.gov.in/Ministry/pdf/CompaniesAct2013.pdf Companies Act 2013] p.91 The compensation offered to such Independent Directors in the form of "sitting fee" has also been increased from Rs. 20,000 (prescribed by Companies Act, 1956) to a maximum of Rs. 1,00,000/- per meeting. The requirements in Kenya are similar to those in India. (These are to be found in the Companies Act, Cap 486 Laws of Kenya). ==Effectiveness== Some researchers have complained that firms have appointed "independent directors who are overly sympathetic to management, while still technically independent according to regulatory definitions."[http://www.people.hbs.edu/lcohen/pdffiles/malcofrazIII.pdf Hiring Cheerleaders: Board Appointments of "Independent" Directors] Lauren Cohen, Andrea Frazzini Christopher J. Malloy One complaint against the independence regulations is that CEOs may find loopholes to influence directors. While the NYSE has a $1 million limit on business dealing between directors and the firm, this does not include charitable contributions. Two critics of management influence over boards note that "a director who is an officer or employee of a charitable organization can still be considered independent even if the firm on whose board the director sits contributes more than $1 million to that organization."''[https://books.google.com/books?id=JDDnbxaleNsC&pg=PA29&lpg=PA29&dq=As+for+charitable+contributions,+the+NYSE+standards+make+it+clear&source=bl&ots=QIBVRne2wb&sig=yA4Qie5Rp8OQxrlczVEhXHfYOMo&hl=en&sa=X&ei=84JjUN61MYjFyAGpjYH4Dw&ved=0CCAQ6AEwAA#v=onepage&q&f=false Pay Without Performance: The Unfulfilled Promise of Executive Compensation]'' By Lucian Arye Bebchuk, Jesse M. Fried] (p.29) ==See also== *[[Non-executive director]] ==References== {{Reflist}} * ''The Role of Independent Directors After Sarbanes-Oxley'', By Bruce F. Dravis [[Category:Board of directors]] [[Category:Business occupations]]

{{notability|bio|date=February 2010}} '''Jari Komulainen''' is a [[Finns|Finnish]] businessman. He became famous by being married to the [[Finnish President]] [[Mauno Koivisto]]’s daughter, [[Assi Koivisto]].
==Personal life==
Jari Komulainen married Assi Koivisto, the daughter of President Mauno Koivisto in a lavish wedding in the Presidential summer palace, [[Kultaranta]], in 1982.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.mtv3.fi/viihde/uutiset/muut.shtml/754984?koivisto_mauno |title=Mauno Koivisto tänään 85 vuotta - Katso hauskat kuvat vuosien varrelta - MTV3.fi - Viihde - Uutiset |publisher=MTV3.fi |date=1982-06-19 |accessdate=2011-11-11}}</ref> The couple divorced in the 1990s and did not have any children, which was speculated to be the cause to the divorce.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.city.fi/artikkeli/Kuultua/1112/ |title=Turhimot |publisher=City.fi |date= |accessdate=2011-11-11}}</ref> Komulainen’s second marriage to [[Minna Brygger]] produced one child but did not last long <ref>[https://archive.is/20110927154717/http://www.huuto.net/kohteet/anna-lehti-nro-9_2821995/122674218 ]</ref> as he already married [[Anitra Ahtola]] in 1998. The couple got divorced in 2003. Anitra Ahtola is a Finnish [[model (person)|model]] and the first runner up in 1996 [[Miss Finland]] competition. The couple has two children.<ref>https://www.imdb.com/name/nm1392969/bio</ref>
==Business==
Komulainen got into a Russian submarine business with [[Russians|Russian]] partners and purchased a {{sclass2-|Juliett|submarine|0}} {{ship|Soviet submarine|K-77|}} in 1993, which he later chartered to the [[Intermedia]] Film Equities Ltd as a movie set of the [[K-19 Widowmaker]] movie starring [[Liam Neeson]] and [[Harrison Ford]].<ref>[http://www.saratogamuseum.org/juliett/history/historyofjuliett484.html ] {{webarchive |url=https://web.archive.org/web/20110726121234/http://www.saratogamuseum.org/juliett/history/historyofjuliett484.html |date=July 26, 2011 }}</ref> The submarine was also used as a restaurant and Komulainen even held his own [[beauty pageant]], [[Miss Submarine]], on top of his ''K-77'' in [[Helsinki]]. He later married the winner of the competition, Anitra Ahtola.<ref>https://www.imdb.com/name/nm1392969/bio</ref> In 2002, after the film wrapped up, the submarine was purchased by the [[USS Saratoga Museum Foundation]],<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.saratogamuseum.org/ |title=The Home Page of the USS Saratoga Museum Foundation, Inc |publisher=Saratogamuseum.org |date=2010-05-03 |accessdate=2011-11-11}}</ref> towed to [[Collier Point Park]] in Providence, [[Rhode Island]], and opened to the public in August 2002. Komulainen’s company, [[Solo International ltd]], used [[Sanil Europe ltd]] to import scooters and bicycles to the Finnish market. The company had a turnover of 4 million Euros a year, however Komulainen sold Solo International Ltd to [[Solifer Group]] during the summer 2006.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.talouselama.fi/yrityskaupat/article163690.ece |title=Jari Komulainen myi pyöräbisnekset Soliferille - Yrityskaupat - Talouselämä |language=fi |publisher=Talouselama.fi |date= |accessdate=2011-11-11}}</ref>

[[Philippe Pastor]] (great-grandson) | website = }} '''Jean-Baptiste Pastor''' was an Italian-born [[Monaco|Monegasque]] businessman and property developer. ==Early life== Jean-Baptiste Pastor was born '''Giovanni Battista Pastor''' in [[Buggio]], Italy, just across the border from France. He was orphaned at an early age, and was already working as a miner by the age of 13,{{cite news|title=Obituaries: Hélène Pastor|url=http://www.thetimes.co.uk/tto/opinion/obituaries/article4107061.ece|accessdate=16 January 2015|work= [[The Times]] |date=3 June 2014}} or as a stonemason, according to another source.{{cite news|title=Hélène Pastor- obituary|url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/news/obituaries/10849904/Helene-Pastor-obituary.html|accessdate=16 January 2015|work=The Daily Telegraph|date=22 May 2014}} ==Career== He emigrated to [[Monte Carlo]] as a young man in 1880, to seek work on the construction of the [[Saint-Charles Church, Monaco|Saint-Charles Church]].Philippe Bidalon, Roger-Louis Bianchini, Aline Cochard, Laetizia Dannery, Lea Delpont, Jennifer Schwarz, Pauline Sommelet, [http://www.lexpress.fr/informations/vie-economique_654033.html Vie économique], ''L'Express'', December 11, 2003 His career as a public works contractor was a success. Pastor eventually started his own company, – J.B. Pastor & Fils – in 1920,{{cite news|last1=Metcalf|first1=Tom|title=Monaco Murders Reveal Six Hidden Real Estate Billionaires|url=https://www.bloomberg.com/news/2014-10-16/monaco-murders-reveal-six-hidden-real-estate-billionaires.html|accessdate=17 January 2015|work=Bloomberg|date=17 October 2014}} and won the contracts to build Monaco's water supply system. In 1936, [[Prince Louis II of Monaco]] awarded Pastor and his company J.B. Pastor & Fils, the commission to build the country's first football stadium. The [[Stade Louis II (1939)|Stade Louis II]] was finished in 1939 and had a capacity of 12,000. With his newfound wealth, Pastor bought seafront land at low prices after World War II, particularly in the [[Larvotto]] district, when there was still no development east of the casino. With the post-war tourism slump, [[Rainier III, Prince of Monaco|Prince Rainier]] resolved to diversify from gambling and turned Monaco into a [[tax haven]]. In subsequent decades, Pastor's son [[Gildo Pastor|Gildo]] was able to build apartment blocks, after getting planning permission to develop in 1966 on this now very valuable land, retaining ownership, and avoiding long leases to maximise rental income. When his granddaughter, [[Hélène Pastor]] was shot dead in 2014, it was reported that the Pastors were Monaco's "second dynasty", behind the ruling [[Grimaldi family]], with an estimated holding of 15 percent of Monaco's housing stock, valued at approximately [[EUR|€]]20 billion. ==Personal life== Pastor was married and lived in Monaco. His son was [[Gildo Pastor]]. == References == {{Reflist}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Pastor, Jean-Baptiste}} [[Category:Year of birth missing]] [[Category:Year of death missing]] [[Category:People from the Province of Imperia]] [[Category:Monegasque businesspeople]] [[Category:Pastor family]]

In [[Mainstream economics|mainstream economic theories]], the '''labour supply''' is the total hours (adjusted for intensity of effort) that workers wish to work at a given real wage rate. It is frequently represented graphically by a labour supply curve, which shows hypothetical wage rates plotted vertically and the amount of labour that an individual or group of individuals is willing to supply at that wage rate plotted horizontally.
== Neoclassical view == [[File:Labour supply.svg|thumb|300px|This [[backward bending supply curve of labour]] shows how the change in [[real wage]] rates affects the number of hours worked by employees.]] {{See also|Labour economics#Neoclassical microeconomic model - Supply|label 1=Neoclassical microeconomic model of labour supply}} Labour supply curves derive from the 'labour-leisure' trade-off. More hours worked earn higher incomes, but necessitate a cut in the amount of leisure that workers enjoy. Consequently, there are two effects on the amount of labour desired to be supplied due to a change in the real wage rate. As, for example, the real wage rate rises, the [[opportunity cost]] of leisure increases. This tends to make workers supply more labour (the "substitution effect"). However, also as the real wage rate rises, workers earn a higher income for a given number of hours. If leisure is a [[normal good]]—the demand for it increases as income increases—this increase in income tends to make workers supply less labour so they can "spend" the higher income on leisure (the "income effect"). If the substitution effect is stronger than the income effect then the labour supply slopes upward. If, beyond a certain wage rate, the income effect is stronger than the substitution effect, then the labour supply curve [[backward bending supply curve of labour|bends backward]]. Individual labor supply curves can be aggregated to derive the total labour supply of an economy.<ref>Ehrenberg and Smith, "Modern Labor Economics", HarperCollins, 2008</ref>
== Marxist view == {{See also|Reserve army of labour|Proletarization}} From a [[Marxist]] perspective, a labour supply is a core requirement in a [[capitalist society]]. To avoid [[labour shortage]] and ensure a labour supply, a large portion of the population must not possess sources of self-provisioning, which would let them be independent—and they must instead, to survive, be compelled to sell their labour for a [[subsistence|subsistence wage]].<ref>[[Maurice Dobb]] (1947) ''[[Studies in the Development of Capitalism]]'' New York: International Publishers Co. Inc.</ref><ref>[[David Harvey (social theorist)|David Harvey]] (1989) ''[[The Condition of Postmodernity]]''</ref> In the pre-industrial economies wage labour was generally undertaken only by those with little or no land of their own.<ref>[[Peter J. Bowden]] (1967) chapter ''Agricultural prices, farm profits, and rents'', section "A. The long-term movement of agricultural prices" - "The long-term trend of prices". Published in [[The agrarian history of England and Wales]], vol 4: 1500-1640, edited by [[Joan Thirsk]]. Also published in [https://books.google.com/books?id=CWlnHlJrgNYC&pg=PR5&source=gbs_selected_pages&cad=0_1 Chapters from the Agrarian History of England and Wales, 1500-1750], p. 18: "Wage-earning is not a pursuit that is normally engaged for its own sake, and in a peasant economy it is followed only by men with little or no land of their own."</ref>

{{more citations needed|date=September 2009}} {{Infobox video game |title = Lemonade Tycoon
{{small|Lemonade Inc.}} |image = LemonadeTycoon1.jpg |image_size = 250px |developer = [[Hexacto]], [[Jamdat]] |publisher = [[Airborne (publisher)|Airborne]], [[MacPlay]], [[EA Mobile]], [[Broderbund]] |designer = |engine = |released = {{plainlist| *Original: May, 2002 *PocketPC and Palm: December 6, 2002 *Mobile Phone: September 13, 2003 *Mac OS X: April 13, 2005 *iPhone: April 24, 2007}} |genre = [[Business simulation game]] |modes = [[Single player]] |platforms = [[Microsoft Windows]], [[Mac OS X]], [[Palm (PDA)|Palm]], [[Windows Mobile]], [[Phone]], [[iPhone]] }} '''''Lemonade Tycoon''''', first released as ''Lemonade Inc.'', is a [[Adobe Shockwave|Shockwave]]-based game. A free, limited version is available for online play at many sites or the full version with no time restrictions can be purchased online. The goal of Lemonade Tycoon is to sell [[lemonade]] for profit.{{cite web | title =Lemonade Tycoon Review | work =GameZone | date = 2003-02-11 | url=http://pc.gamezone.com/gzreviews/r21410.htm | format=asp | accessdate = 2008-04-26 | archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20050213131723/http://pc.gamezone.com/gzreviews/r21410.htm | archivedate=2005-02-13 }} The last update (1.1.9) was renamed ''Lemonade Tycoon Deluxe''. In 2009 Electronic Arts published an iPhone version of ''Lemonade Tycoon''. ''Lemonade Tycoon 2: New York Edition'' is also available on Mac OS X, published by MacPlay.{{cite web | title=MacPlay: Lemonade Tycoon 2 | url=http://www.macplay.com/games/Lemonade_Tycoon_2 | format=asp | accessdate=2009-04-27 | deadurl=yes | archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20090430021752/http://www.macplay.com/games/Lemonade_Tycoon_2 | archivedate=2009-04-30 | df= }} While selling lemonade, players must look over many aspects of their business. Players decide on a recipe, set prices, and sell lemonade in a variety of locations. The game includes changing weather and news, which the player must compensate for. To overcome some factors, such as long lines and stock, players can buy upgrades. The packaged version included versions for PC, Mobile Phones, Windows Mobile Professional devices, and Palm devices. The game allows players to transfer game saves from a Windows PC to a Palm handheld or Windows Mobile Professional device and back again to continue. ''Lemonade Tycoon'' has similarities to ''[[Lemonade Stand]]'', a computer game originally created for the [[Minnesota Educational Computing Consortium]] in 1973 and later ported by [[Apple Computer]] for use with its then-new [[Apple II]] platform in 1979. The game also required players to make businesses decisions based upon weather, customers, and cost/availability of stock. ==Gameplay== === Game Modes === ''Lemonade Tycoon'' includes three game modes; Career, Challenge and Champion. Career mode lets the player have a stand for as long as they want. Challenge mode had a 30-day limit to see how fast your stand can grow within the period of time. ==== Stocks/Supplies ==== In order to be able to sell lemonade, players have to buy supplies, which include ice, lemons, sugar, and cups. ==== Sales and Advertisement ==== The player has the option to advertise in ''Lemonade Tycoon''. Every day, the player can pay an advertising fee with different choices in advertising being available. Advertising increases the number of potential customers. ==== Upgrades ==== Lemonade Tycoon features many upgrades that are available at different prices. Some reduce wait times, some improve visibility, some make ice, etc. Stand upgrades allow more storage and customer capacity. There are also employees, a cashier, and a clown, which charge daily for reducing wait times and increasing patience, respectively. ==== Locations ==== There are five different locations where one can move your stand. Some places are more popular than others. Each location has a different rent. Each location has satisfaction and popularity. Popularity changes as the player's stand gets more popular. Good satisfaction and advertising bring more customers. Satisfaction ensures that customers will come back to the stand. If there are short lines, there are good prices, the player serves all customers rather than them leaving, and the player has a good recipe, the player's customer satisfaction will go up. With the increase of satisfaction, customers will come back to a player's stand. Satisfaction and popularity are location based. They do not travel with you as you move from location to location. ==== Game Factors ==== There are many News Headlines that affect the success of lemonade sales. Some headlines improve the player's business and some hurt it. Headlines change every game day and sometimes only affect a single location. Weather also affects sales - warm and hot days bring more customers than cold, rainy days. The weather changes each day and does not seem to follow predictable patterns. === Lemonade Stock Exchange (LSX) === The Lemonade Stock Exchange was an online feature that let one see how one's stand compared to others. ==Reception== === Awards === * Best Pocket PC Strategy Game (2002 Pocket PC Magazine's Best Products Awards) {{cite web|url= http://www.pocketpcmag.com/awards/winners_2002.asp?cat=38|title= Annual Pocket PC Best Product Awards: Winners and Finalists|accessdate= 2008-04-27|work= pocketpcmag|deadurl= yes|archiveurl= https://web.archive.org/web/20071121065030/http://www.pocketpcmag.com/awards/winners_2002.asp?cat=38|archivedate= 2007-11-21|df= }} ===Applied uses=== [[Learning Planet]], an educational website, created the original version of the game for teaching economics and resource management for its students. The LearningPlanet.com version of Lemonade Tycoon is visually different but functionally identical to the other iterations of the game.{{cite web | title =How About a Nice Cup of Lemonade? | work =LearningPlanet.com | publisher =Planet Interactive, Inc. | date =2007 | url =http://www.learningplanet.com/articles/lt/index.asp | format =asp | accessdate =2007-04-18 | deadurl =yes | archiveurl =https://web.archive.org/web/20070317235940/http://www.learningplanet.com/articles/lt/index.asp | archivedate =2007-03-17 | df = }} ==References== {{reflist|2}} [[Category:2002 video games]] [[Category:Mobile games]] [[Category:IOS games]] [[Category:Windows games]] [[Category:Business simulation games]] [[Category:Personal digital assistant software]] [[Category:Video games developed in the United States]] [[Category:Windows Mobile Professional games]] [[Category:Palm OS games]]

[[Spence School|Miss Spence's School]] }} '''Madeleine Talmage Force Fiermonte ''' (June 19, 1893 – March 27, 1940) was an American socialite and a survivor of the {{RMS|Titanic}}.{{cite web|title=Madeleine Force Astor Biography - Facts, Birthday, Life Story - Biography.com|url=http://www.biography.com/people/madeleine-force-astor-283808|publisher=Biography.com|accessdate=17 July 2013}} She was also the second wife and widow of businessman [[John Jacob Astor IV]]. ==Early life== [[Image:Katherine and Madeleine circa 1908.jpg|left|thumb|180px|Katherine (left) and Madeleine Force.]] Madeleine Talmage Force was born on June 19, 1893, in [[Brooklyn, New York]], the younger daughter of William Hurlbut Force (1852–1917) and the former Katherine Arvilla Talmage (1863–1930). Madeleine's elder sister [[Katherine Emmons Force]] was a real estate businesswoman and socialite. Through their father William, she and Katherine had French ancestry and were grandnieces of builder Ephraim S. Force (1822 – March 12, 1914).{{cite web|title=E. S. FORCE DIES AT 92|url=https://timesmachine.nytimes.com/timesmachine/1914/03/12/101917768.pdf|newspaper=New York Times|date=March 12, 1914}} Their mother Katherine had Dutch ancestry. William Hurlbut Force was a member of a well-established business family. He owned the successful shipping firm William H. Force and Co., and his father had been prosperous in the manufacturing industry. In 1889, Force had married Katherine Talmage, who was the granddaughter of former Brooklyn mayor Thomas Talmage. The Forces were part of Brooklyn high society, while William Force was a member of numerous prestigious clubs in the city.Jervis, A. 1893 "The Eagle and Brooklyn: the record of the progress of the Brooklyn daily eagle", p. 1016. Online reference https://archive.org/stream/cu31924092229347#page/n379/mode/1up He also owned a notable art collection. Like the Astor family, the Forces were members of the Episcopal Church. She was educated at Miss Ely's School and then for four years at [[Spence School|Miss Spence's School]], which was located at West 48th Street in Manhattan. According to one report she was "counted an especially brilliant pupil" at this school. She was also taken abroad with her sister Katherine by her mother and toured Europe several times. When she was introduced to New York social life she was immediately adopted by the "Junior League" which was a clique of debutantes.''The Washington Times'', August 3, 1911, p. 8. Online reference http://chroniclingamerica.loc.gov/lccn/sn84026749/1911-08-03/ed-1/seq-8/ She appeared in several New York society plays and attracted quite a following. She was known to be a very competent horsewoman and enjoyed yachting. One report said that she was bright and good with drawing-room conversation. ==Courtship and marriage== [[File:JJAstorIV.jpg|thumb|left|Madeleine with Colonel Astor.]] [[Image:Madeleine JackAstor.jpg|right|thumb|230px|Madeleine with John and their Airedale, Kitty.]] She met Colonel John Jacob "Jack" Astor IV, the only son of businessman [[William Backhouse Astor, Jr.]] and socialite [[Caroline Webster Schermerhorn Astor|Caroline Webster "Lina" Schermerhorn]].The New York Times, September 4, 1910. Online reference https://timesmachine.nytimes.com/timesmachine/1910/09/04/105089609.pdf During their courtship he took her on automobile drives and yacht trips and they were often followed by the press. They became engaged in August 1911 and were married on September 9, 1911.{{cite news |title=Col. Astor Weds Madeleine Force |url=http://www.encyclopedia-titanica.org/col-astor-weds-madeleine-force.html |quote=Col. John Jacob Astor, head of the Astor family in America, and one of this country's wealthiest men, was married at 9:55 o'clock this morning to Miss Madeleine Talmage Force, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. William H. Force, of New York, at the Newport home of the bridegroom, Beechwood, on the Cliffs and Bellevue Avenue. |newspaper=[[New York Times]] |date=September 9, 1911 |accessdate=2012-11-26 }} There was a considerable amount of opposition to his marriage not only because of their age difference{{cite web|title=Titanic Survivor Stories - Madeleine Talmage Force Astor|url=http://www.rmstitanic.net/community/blog/268-titanic-survivor-madeleine|publisher=rmstitanic.net|accessdate=17 July 2013}} but because of his recent divorce (November 1909) from his previous wife. Several Episcopal priests refusing to celebrate the nuptials,''Meriden Morning Herald'', August 9, 1911, p. 9. Online reference https://news.google.com/newspapers?id=419HAAAAIBAJ&sjid=tf4MAAAAIBAJ&pg=2297,6445286&dq=madeleine-force&hl=en the couple were eventually married by a Congregationalist minister at [[Beechwood (Astor mansion)|Beechwood]], his Newport mansion.''Meriden Morning Herald'', September 14, 1911, p. 10. Online reference https://news.google.com/newspapers?id=kk9HAAAAIBAJ&sjid=cv4MAAAAIBAJ&pg=4002,2593850&dq=madeleine-force&hl=en His son [[Vincent Astor|William Vincent Astor]] served as best man.{{cite web|title=COL. ASTOR WEDS MADELEINE FORCE :: New York Times|url=http://www.encyclopedia-titanica.org/col-astor-weds-madeleine-force.html|publisher=encyclopedia titanica|accessdate=17 July 2013}} After their marriage, they had an extended honeymoon. They visited several places locally first, then in January 1912, they sailed from New York on the ''Titanic''’s sister ship, the ''Olympic'', and enjoyed a long Egyptian tour.Maxtone-Graham, J. 2012 "Titanic Tragedy: A New Look at the Lost". Online reference https://books.google.com/books?id=5s7t6O7U5XYC&pg=PT84&dq=john+astor+titanic+honeymoon&hl=en&sa=X&ei=18p_T9anBJOgiQeJxpTGBA&ved=0CFcQ6AEwBQ#v=onepage&q=john%20astor%20titanic%20honeymoon&f=false It was while returning from this part of their honeymoon that they booked their passage on the ''Titanic''. ==Aboard the ''Titanic''== [[File:Titanic-New York Herald front page 2.jpeg|right|thumb|300px|Newspaper report of the sinking of the Titanic. Most reports featured the Astors in the headlines.]] Madeleine Astor, then five months pregnant, boarded the ''Titanic'' as a first-class passenger in [[Cherbourg]], France, with her husband; her husband's valet, Victor Robbins; her maid, Rosalie Bidois; and her nurse, Caroline Endres. They also took Kitty, Astor's pet [[Airedale Terrier|Airedale]], and occupied one of the parlor suites. On the night of April 14, 1912, Colonel Astor reported to his wife that the ship had hit an [[iceberg]]. He reassured her that the damage did not appear serious, though he helped her strap on her lifebelt. While they were waiting on the boat-deck, Mrs. Astor lent Leah Aks, a third-class passenger, her fur shawl to keep her son, Filly, warm. At one point, the Astors retired to the gymnasium and sat on the mechanical horses in their lifebelts. Colonel Astor found another lifebelt which he reportedly cut with a pen knife to show Madeleine what it was made of. When it was time to board a life boat, Madeleine Astor, her maid, and her nurse had to crawl through the first-class promenade window into the tilting [[lifeboat (shipboard)|lifeboat]] 4 (which had been lowered down to A deck to take on more passengers). Astor had helped his wife to climb through the window and asked if he could accompany her as she was 'in a delicate condition'. The request was denied by Second Officer [[Charles Lightoller]].{{cite web |url= http://www.encyclopedia-titanica.org/titanic-biography/john-jacob-astor.html|title= Colonel John Jacob Astor|work= encyclopedia titanica|accessdate=April 4, 2011}} An account of Madeleine's boarding of the lifeboat was given by [[Archibald Gracie IV]] to the [[American Titanic inquiry|US Senate Titanic inquiry]]. Gracie was a fellow passenger and recalled the events regarding Madeleine Astor in the following terms.
"The only incident I remember in particular at this point is when Mrs Astor was put in the boat. She was lifted up through the window, and her husband helped her on the other side, and when she got in, her husband was on one side of this window and I was on the other side, at the next window. I heard Mr Astor ask the second officer whether he would not be allowed to go aboard this boat to protect his wife. He said, 'No, sir, no man is allowed on this boat or any of the boats until the ladies are off.' Mr Astor then said, 'Well, tell me what is the number of this boat so I may find her afterwards,' or words to that effect. The answer came back, 'No. 4.".United States Senate Inquiry into the Titanic. Online reference http://www.titanicinquiry.org/USInq/AmInq11Gracie01.php
Astor and his valet died in the sinking; the former's body was recovered on April 22. He was found to be carrying approximately two thousand five hundred dollars in cash,{{cite web |url= http://www.encyclopedia-titanica.org/titanic-biography/john-jacob-astor.html|work= encyclopedia titanica}} brought with him from his cabin. His young widow and the other survivors were rescued by the [[RMS Carpathia|RMS ''Carpathia'']]. Madeleine Astor gave an account of what she recalled almost immediately after her arrival home through her spokesman Nicholas Biddle who was a trustee of the Astor Estate. The account given by her spokesman is as follows.
"On landing from the Carpathia the young bride widowed by the Titanic's sinking told members of her family what she could recall of the circumstances of the disaster. Of how Colonel Astor had met his death she had no definite conception.'' She recalled she thought that in the confusion as she was about to be put into one of the boats Colonel Astor was standing by her side. After that she had no very clear recollection of the happenings until the boats were well clear of the sinking steamer.'' Mrs Astor, it appears, left in one of the last boats which got away from the ship. It was her belief that all the women who wished to go had then been taken off. Her impression was that the boat she left in had room for at least 15 more persons. The men, for some reason (that) she could not and does not now understand, did not seem to be at all anxious to leave the ship. Almost everyone seemed dazed."The San Francisco Call., April 19, 1912, p. 1. Online reference http://chroniclingamerica.loc.gov/lccn/sn85066387/1912-04-19/ed-1/seq-1/
==Widowhood== [[Image:Madeleine Astor at Belmont Park 1915.jpg|right|thumb|230px|Madeleine Astor 1915.]] After Astor returned home from her ordeal, she was kept in strict retirement. Her first social function was not until the end of May when she held a luncheon at her mansion on Fifth Avenue for [[Arthur Rostron]], the Captain of the ''Carpathia'', and Dr. Frank McGee, the ship’s surgeon. She held this event with [[Marian Thayer]], who was also a survivor of the ''Titanic''. Both women wished to thank these men for their assistance when they were on board the ''Carpathia''.''The Evening World'' (New York)., May 31, 1912, p. 1. Online reference http://chroniclingamerica.loc.gov/lccn/sn83030193/1912-05-31/ed-1/seq-1/ In his will, John Jacob Astor IV left his wife an outright sum of $100,000. In addition, he bequeathed to her the income from a trust fund of $5 million and the use during her life of the house on Fifth Avenue. Both of these latter provisions, she would lose if she remarried. A fund of $3 million was set aside for his unborn child [[John Jacob Astor VI|John Jacob "Jakey" Astor VI]] which he would control when he became of age.''The Evening News'' (Providence R I), May 7, 1912, p. 1. Online reference https://news.google.com/newspapers?id=QupgAAAAIBAJ&sjid=u2MNAAAAIBAJ&pg=2415,1723472&dq=madeleine+force+astor&hl=en On August 14, 1912, Astor gave birth to Jakey at her Fifth Avenue mansion. For the next four years, she raised him as part of the Astor family. She did not seem to appear very often in society until the end of 1913, when according to the press they were able to publish her first photograph since the ''Titanic'' disaster.''The Logan Republican'', November 29, 1913, p. 1. Online reference http://chroniclingamerica.loc.gov/lccn/sn85058246/1913-11-29/ed-1/seq-1/ After this, she appeared more often in public and her activities were frequently reported in the press. In 1915, she remodelled her house on Fifth Avenue and this was made a feature article in the ''New York Sun''.''The Sun'' (New York), April 25, 1915, p. Supplement 9. Online reference http://chroniclingamerica.loc.gov/lccn/sn83030272/1915-04-25/ed-1/seq-41/ There were also many articles about her eldest son. ==Remarriages== Four years after Colonel Astor's death, Madeleine Astor married her childhood friend banker William Karl Dick (May 28, 1888 – September 5, 1953) on June 22, 1916, in [[Bar Harbor, Maine]]. He was a vice president of the [[Manufacturers Trust Company]] of New York and a part owner and director of the ''Brooklyn Times''. As stated in Colonel Astor's will, she lost her stipend from his trust fund. They had two sons: * William Force Dick (April 11, 1917 – December 4, 1961) * [[John Henry Dick]] II, ornithologist, photographer, naturalist, conservationist, author, painter, and bird illustrator{{cite web|title=William K. Dick|url=http://www.accuracyproject.org/cbe-Dick,WilliamK.html|publisher=Accuracy Project|accessdate=January 1, 2012}} They divorced on July 21, 1933, in [[Reno, Nevada]]. Four months later, on November 27, 1933, Astor married Italian actor/boxer [[Enzo Fiermonte]] in a civil ceremony in New York City. They honeymooned in [[Palm Beach, Florida]]. They eventually moved there. They had no children together and divorced on June 11, 1938, in [[West Palm Beach, Florida]]. ==Death== Madeleine Fiermonte died of a heart ailment at her mansion in [[Palm Beach, Florida]], on March 27, 1940, at the age of 46.{{cite news|author=[[Associated Press]] |title=Mrs. Fiermonte Dead In Florida |url=http://www.encyclopedia-titanica.org/item/3259/ |quote=The household of Mrs. Madeleine Force Astor Fiermonte stated early today that she was dead. Mrs. Madeleine Force Astor Dick Fiermonte was married three times, and divorced twice. Her first marriage to Colonel John Jacob Astor, head of the Astor family in this country, was of short duration, ending when he lost his life in the Titanic disaster. Her second union, that with William K. Dick, member of a family whose fortune was made in the sugar refining business, terminated when she divorced him in Reno.....|newspaper=[[New York Times]] |date=March 28, 1940 |accessdate=October 19, 2010 }} She was buried in [[Trinity Church Cemetery]] in [[New York City]], in a [[mausoleum]] with her mother. ==Portrayals== * Charlotte Thiele (''[[Titanic (1943 film)|Titanic]]'', 1943) * [[Frances Bergen]] (''[[Titanic (1953 film)|Titanic]]'', 1953) * Beverly Ross (''[[S.O.S. Titanic]]'', 1979 TV movie) * [[Janne Mortil]] (''[[Titanic (1996 TV miniseries)|''Titanic'']]'', 1996 miniseries) * [[Charlotte Chatton]] (''[[Titanic (1997 film)|Titanic]]'', 1997) * Piper Gunnarson (''[[Ghosts of the Abyss]]'', 2003 documentary) * Angéla Eke (''[[Titanic (2012 miniseries)|Titanic]]'', 2012 miniseries) ==References== {{reflist|30em}} ==External links== * {{cite web |author1=Behe, George |author2=Phillip Gowan, Hermann Sōldner | title=Mrs Madeleine Talmage Astor (nèe Force) | work=Encyclopedia Titanica | url=http://www.encyclopedia-titanica.org/biography/12/ | accessdate=July 15, 2005 }} * [http://www.titanic-titanic.com/death_certificate_astor_madeleine.shtml Madeleine Astor Death Certificate on Titanic-Titanic.com] * {{Find a Grave|6596962}} * [http://www.titanic-passengers.com/madeleineastor.htm Madeleine Astor] at Titanic-Passengers.com {{RMS Titanic}} {{Authority control}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Astor, Madeline}} [[Category:1893 births]] [[Category:1940 deaths]] [[Category:RMS Titanic's crew and passengers]] [[Category:Astor family|Madeleine]] [[Category:Livingston family]] [[Category:American socialites]] [[Category:RMS Titanic survivors]] [[Category:People from Brooklyn]] [[Category:Burials at Trinity Church Cemetery]] [[Category:Spence School alumni]]

{{Use dmy dates|date=March 2017}} {{Use British English|date=March 2017}} '''Sir Nicholas Fairfax''' (1498/99 – 1571), of [[Gilling Castle]] and Walton, Yorkshire, was an English politician.<ref> {{cite web|url=http://www.historyofparliamentonline.org/volume/1509-1558/member/fairfax-sir-nicholas-149899-1571|title=FAIRFAX, Sir Nicholas (1498/99-1571), of Gilling Castle and Walton, Yorks.|publisher=History of Parliament Online|accessdate=4 September 2017}}</ref>
He was born the eldest son of Sir [[Thomas Fairfax (Gilling)|Thomas Fairfax]] of [[Gilling Castle]] and educated at the [[Middle Temple]]. He succeeded his father in 1520 and was knighted before 1530.
He was selected [[High Sheriff of Yorkshire]] for 1531–32, 1544–1555 and 1561–62.
He was a [[Member of Parliament]] (MP) for [[Scarborough (UK Parliament constituency)|Scarborough]] in 1542 and for [[Yorkshire (UK Parliament constituency)|Yorkshire]] in 1547 and 1563.
He died in 1571. He had married twice, firstly Jane, the daughter of [[Guy Palmes]] of Naburn, with whom he had at least 8 sons and at least 4 daughters and secondly Alice, the daughter of (Sir) [[John Harington (died 1553)|John Harington]] of Exton, Rutland and the widow of Richard Flower of Whitwell, Rutland and of Sir Henry Sutton of Averham, Nottinghamshire. He was succeeded by his eldest son Sir [[William Fairfax (died 1597)|William Fairfax]], who was also an MP for Yorkshire and High Sheriff of the county.
